title: Tags
body:
## Overview **Tags** are user-assigned notations that can be applied to providers or provider locations. There are multiple places in the system where tags can be assigned, including Detail Results, Provider Profile pages, Recruitment List, and Accessibility. The Tagging feature in Network360 allows users to tag providers or providers at specific locations with keywords so that they can be easily found again when filtering or searching. Tags are categorized into four groups: System Generated, Global, Enterprise, and User. ## Creating Tags To view all available tags and create new User tags, navigate to **Settings > Project Settings > Tags** tab. You can create your own tags on the Tags tab. ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/creating-tag.png) ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/creating-tag1.png) ## Adding Tags
1. To create your own tags, scroll down to the \*\*User Tags\*\* section. Click on \*\*Add User tag\*\* button. ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/creating-tag2.png) 2. Enter the tag name to be added as a User Tag. Click the **Add Tag** button. ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/creating-tag3.png) 3. A success or unsuccessful message will be displayed. If successful, the tag will be added to the User Tag list. ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/creating-tag4.png) ## Deleting created Tags When necessary, you can click on the delete icon to delete the created tag. A notification asking for confirmation of deleting the tag will be displayed. Select **Yes** to delete the existing tag. ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/deleteing-created-tag1.png) ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/deleting-created-tag2.png) ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/deleting-created-tag3.png) ## Renaming Created Tags When necessary, you can click on the edit icon to rename the created tag. Enter the new name of the tag and click on **Save** button. A success message will be displayed. ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/editing-tag-name.png) ## Using Tags in Search Criteria of Create a List
Create a List is available within Recruitment & Research and within Sales Tools. Use the left side bar navigation panel to select either Recruitment & Research or Sales Tools. Using Create a List, you can develop a summary of a list of providers that meet your selected criteria. To use tags to search in this module, first enter your desired search criteria. Then, select tags that the provider would be **Tagged with** or **Not tagged with**. The list of tags within the criteria section consists of only tags assigned within the project. The **Tagged with** and **Not tagged with** fields both work in the same manner. ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/tags_create-a-list.png)
**Note:**
On the **Create a List** Provider List page, you can add tags to provider or provider locations. However, you cannot add tags to provider or provider locations within the search criteria page. If you want to query the provider data based on previously assigned tags, select one or more from the list. If no tags are present in the list, that means no providers have been tagged. If you want to ensure that each provider returned in the search has matched on all tags that you have selected, select the **must have all tags** check box. ## Tagging Providers
You can apply tags to a provider when you are on a Provider Profile, regardless of the path you took to get there. 1. Click on **Tags for provider at this location**. This will open a popup box. 2. Click on the **+** icon to assign one or more tags to this provider at this location. ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/adding-tags-to-provider-profile1.png) 3. You can select the required tag from the list of tags available in the dropdown. ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/adding-tags-to-provider-profile2.png) 4. You can assign more than one tag depending on the relevance. 5. Click on the **Delete** icon to remove the **Select or create a tag** selection dropdown. 6. Click on **x** to remove the already existing tag. ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/adding-tags-to-provider-profile3.png) ### Tagging a provider at a location from Accessibility module
1. From the Gap Map in Accessibility, click on a provider to display provider information. 2. Under the name and address, click the "Provider tags" or "Provider at this location tags" icon or link. 3. The "Tags for provider" or "Tags for provider at this location" window opens, where you can apply existing tags, or create and apply new tags. 4. Once a tag is selected, it is applied to the Provider or Provider at a location. ### Tag color Tag colors help differentiate the type of tag. **Orange:** User tags are created and managed by the individual user. User tags can only be seen and used by the user who created them. Any user can create, edit or delete a user tag from the system. **Green:** Enterprise tags are defined by Administrators of the project. Enterprise tags can be seen and used by all user in the project. Administrative users can create, edit or delete an Enterprise tag from the system. **Blue:** Global tags are system-wide tags available to every client (i.e., Recruiting: Target, Inactive: Retired). Global tags can be seen and used by all users in the project. Global tags cannot be edited or deleted from the system by any user. **Purple:** System Generated Automatic tags are automatically applied when data is imported into the system (i.e., Medicare PAR). System Generated tags can be seen by all users in the project but cannot be applied to or removed from a provider or provider location. System Generated tags cannot be edited or deleted from the system by any user. ## Bulk Tags Bulk tags are used to save time and allow you to assign tags to more than one provider or provider location at the same time. Bulk Tags are assigned on: The **Provider List** displayed in the **Detail results** page of **Competitive Dashboard, Compare Networks, Create a List** and **Model Networks** modules and **Recruitment** list displayed in **Detail Results** page of the **Recruitment** module. For example, **Inactive: Deceased** or **Recruiting: Credentialing**. Procedure to add one or more tags: 1. Click the **Tags** button in the upper right corner of the Provider Profile or Detail Results page. ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/tag.png) The Bulk Tagging dialog box will open. ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/creatalist_details_tags.png) 2. Select the tagging level, **Provider** or **Provider at displayed location**. ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/bulk-tagging2.png) 3. Check boxes will be displayed next to each provider in the list. Select the check boxes for the providers to which you want to apply a tag. 4. Select an existing tag from the dropdown list or create a new tag. ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/bulktagging3.png) 5. Click the **Apply Tags** button. Tags will display within the Details List or Providers profile below the providerâ€™s name. The tag icons are different for Provider Level and Provider at displayed location level. ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/creatalist_details_tags_icons.png) Each have hover text messages. And each are links to open additional information. ![](/cms/cms-assets/media/creatalist_details_tags_hover.png)
shortDescription: Tags are user-assigned notations for providers or provider locations. They can be used to search for providers and provider locations.
